src package

src.aws_rekognition module

Module to handle AWS Rekognition API calls for facial recognition.

class src.aws_rekognition.AWSPersonTup(name, match_confidence)

Bases: tuple

match_confidence

Alias for field number 1

name

Alias for field number 0

src.aws_rekognition.detect_labels(file_name, debug=False)[source]

Method to take a file stored in S3 bucket BUCKET_NAME and send it through AWS Rekognition, returning facial recognition data from its celebrity database.

Parameters:

  • file_name (str) – Name of the file to scan in Rekognize stored in S3

  • debug (bool) – Enable debug mode

Returns:

Tuple containing (Person’s name, Match confidence, Facial feature mapping data) or False if an error occurred

Return type:

AWSPersonTup or bool

src.benchmark_local_facial_recognition module

R-IBES facial recognition benchmarking script

src.benchmark_local_facial_recognition.benchmark()[source]

Benchmark the local facial recognition system.

src.benchmark_local_facial_recognition.get_encodings()[source]

Get all encodings from the database.

Returns:

All encodings from the database in form {name: [encoding1, encoding2, …]}

Return type:

dict{str, list(ndarray(128,))}

src.benchmark_local_facial_recognition.stats(success_rates, avg_times, num_zero_success_rates, number_of_people, avg_non_zero_success_rates)[source]

Calculate the statistics for the benchmark.

Parameters:

  • success_rates (list(float)) – List of success rates for each person

  • avg_times (list(float)) – List of average times to compare all encodings for each person

  • num_zero_success_rates (int) – Number of people with 0% success rate

  • number_of_people (int) – Total number of people in the database

  • avg_non_zero_success_rates (list(float)) – List of success rates for each person excluding those with 0% success rates

Returns:

Average success rate, average encoding comparison time, percent of people with 0% success rate, and average non-zero success rate

Return type:

float, float, float, float

src.clear_db module

Running this file clears the database of all images, encodings, and names.

src.clear_db.main(proceed=False)[source]

Clear the database, delete all images, and delete file structure.

src.conversions module

File providing conversion methods for the R-IBES system.

Convert a facial encoding in numpy ndarray format to a hex memoryview

Returns:

src.conversions.get_denormalized_name(normalized_name)[source]

Standard conversion from a normalized name to a denormalized name (jacob_weber -> Jacob Weber)

Parameters:

normalized_name (str) – Name to denormalize

Returns:

Denormalized name (title case, spaces instead of underscores)

Return type:

str

src.conversions.get_normalized_name(name)[source]

Standard conversion from a name to a normalized name (Jacob Weber -> jacob_weber)

Parameters:

name (str) – Name to normalize

Returns:

Normalized name (lowercase, underscores instead of spaces)

Return type:

str

Bases: object

Node class for storing a resource and the question that was asked to get to that resource.

src.entity_search.add_edges(graph, node)[source]

Add edges to the graph recursively.

Parameters:

  • graph (AGraph) – Graph representation of the tree.

  • node (Node) – Current node to add edges for.

src.entity_search.call_dbpedia(resource, question, resource_link=False, debug=False)[source]

Run a SPARQL query on DBpedia.

Parameters:

  • resource (str) – Resource to search for (can be the original query’s entity or a derived entity).

  • question (str) – DBO/DBP (biographical) tag to search for on a given entity page.

  • resource_link (bool) – Whether the provided resource is a dbpedia link (occurs during recursive search). True if a link; False otherwise.

  • debug (bool) – Enable debug mode

Returns:

Result of the question asked by the resource/question pair.

Return type:

list(str)

src.entity_search.generate_file_name(name, questions)[source]

Generate a file name for the tree visualization.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Normalized name of the entity to search for.

  • questions (list(str)) – A list of DBO/DBP (biographical) tags to search for on a given entity page.

Returns:

File name for the tree visualization and file name for JSON dump.

Return type:

str, str

src.entity_search.main(query, name, debug=False)[source]

Main method for the entity search module.

Parameters:

  • query (str) – Query to run on the given entity. Query terms must be in the form of DBO/DBP tags.

  • name (str) – Normalized name of the entity to search for.

  • debug (bool) – Enable debug mode

src.entity_search.print_tree_dict(tree)[source]

Print the tree in a JSON format.

Parameters:

tree (dict) – Dictionary representation of the tree.

src.entity_search.save_json(json_dict, file_name)[source]

Save a JSON dictionary to a file.

Parameters:

  • json_dict (dict) – Dictionary to save to a file.

  • file_name (str) – Name of the file to save the JSON dictionary to.

Parameters:

node (Node) – Current node to convert to add to the dictionary.

Returns:

Dictionary representation of the tree.

Return type:

dict

src.entity_search.visualize_tree(root, image_name='tree.png')[source]

Visualize the tree using pygraphviz.

Parameters:

  • root (Node) – Root node of the tree to visualize.

  • image_name (str) – Name of the image to save the tree to.

src.local_facial_recognition module

This file handles all the local facial recognition functionality.

Bases: tuple

matchCount

Alias for field number 0

notMatchCount

Alias for field number 1

src.local_facial_recognition.compare_encoding_to_person(encoding, name, compare_encodings)[source]

Given an encoding and a person’s name, compare the encoding to all encodings of that person

Parameters:

  • encoding (ndarray(128,)) – Encoding to compare against all encodings of the person

  • name (str) – Name of the person to compare the encoding to

  • compare_encodings (list(ndarray(128,))) – All encodings of a given person to compare the encoding to

Returns:

CompareResult of the comparison

Return type:

CompareResult

src.local_facial_recognition.generate_face_encoding(file_location, name='', source='user', debug=False)[source]

Provided the path to an image, generate a facial encoding from that image. If a name is provided, save the encoding into the DB.

Parameters:

  • file_location (str) – Path of a file (including file name) to generate a facial encoding

  • name (str or None) – Name of the person in the picture (optional)

  • source (str) – Source of the images. Default is ‘user’ (user provided) but can also be databases such as ‘lfw’ (Labeled Faces in the Wild).

  • debug (bool) – If True, print debug statements

Returns:

A list of 128-dimensional face encodings

Return type:

list(float)

src.local_facial_recognition.get_person_db_encodings(name, debug=False)[source]

Given a name retrieve all the facial encodings corresponding to that person

Parameters:

  • name (str) – Name of the person to retrieve facial encodings for

  • debug (bool) – Enable debug mode

Returns:

List of facial encodings corresponding to the person with name name

Return type:

list(nd_array)

src.local_facial_recognition.get_person_directory(name)[source]

Given a name, retrieve the directory of that person

Parameters:

name (str) – Name of the person to retrieve the directory for

Returns:

Directory of the person

Return type:

str or None

src.local_facial_recognition.identify_person_from_encoding(encoding, debug=False)[source]

Given an encoding, compare it to all encodings in the database to find the person’s name.

Parameters:

  • encoding (ndarray(128,)) – Encoding to compare against all encodings in the database. Encoding of the person to identify.

  • debug (bool) – Enables debug mode

Returns:

Name of the person with the most matches or UNKNOWN if no matches were found

Return type:

str

src.local_facial_recognition.save_face_encoding(encoding, name, file_name, source='user')[source]

Provided a face encoding and the name of the person in the image, save the encoding to that corresponding person’s encoding set

Parameters:

  • encoding (memoryview) – Face encoding generated by face_recognition.face_encodings()

  • name (str) – Name of the person in the image

  • file_name (str) – Name of the file the encoding was generated from (Example: George_W_Bush_0525.jpg)

  • source (str) – Source of the images. Default is ‘user’ (user provided) but can also be databases such as ‘lfw’ (Labeled Faces in the Wild).

Returns:

True for successful save, False for error

Return type:

bool

src.local_facial_recognition.save_image(file_location, name, new_file_name)[source]

Provided an image save it in the proper location given the person’s name

Parameters:

  • file_location (str) – Path of a file (including file name)

  • name (str) – Name of the person in the picture

  • new_file_name (str) – Name of the file to save the image as

src.s3_operations module

This file contains functions for uploading, downloading, and deleting files from an S3 bucket.

Delete a file from an S3 bucket after it has been downloaded and is no longer needed online.

  • debug (bool) – Enable debug mode

Returns:

Success state of the deletion – True if successful, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

src.user_contribution module

This file contains the methods to handle user contributions to the local facial recognition database.

src.user_contribution.ask_contribute(file_path)[source]

Method to ask the user if they would like to contribute to the local facial recognition database.

Parameters:

file_path (str) – Path of the file the user provided.

Returns:

Whether the user consents to contributing to the local db.

Return type:

bool

src.user_contribution.contribute(file_location, upload_encoding)[source]

Method to add a user-provided image to the local facial recognition database.

Parameters:

  • file_location (str) – Local location of the file to add to the local db

  • upload_encoding (ndarray(128,)) – Pre-computed encoding of the image to add to the local db

Returns:

Result of the addition to the local db (True if successful, False otherwise) AND the name of the person

Return type:

bool, str

src.user_contribution.get_user_contributed_name()[source]

Method to request a name from the user to save to the local facial recognition database in case AWS Rekognize was unable to match their provided image to a known celebrity.

Returns:

Full name (first last) of the person in the user-provided photo.

Return type:

str
